item.title: Tender Mercies of the Lord
item.description: (1 Nephi 1:20) Elder David A. Bednar talks about the tender mercies of the Lord.

item.title: 1 Nephi through Omni (Segment 1)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark.

item.title: Spiritual Immunization
item.description: (2 Nephi 32:3–5) President Boyd K. Packer talks about spiritual immunization.

item.title: The Book of Mormon "Shall Hiss Forth"
item.description: (2 Nephi 29:2) President Ezra Taft Benson talks about how the Book of Mormon ”shall hiss forth”.

item.title: Abrahamic Covenant
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about the Abrahamic covenant.

item.title: Line upon Line
item.description: (2 Nephi 28:30) Elder David A. Bednar teaches that our spiritual development should be “line upon line”.

item.title: All Is Well in Zion
item.description: (2 Nephi 28:20–24) President Thomas S. Monson talks about Zion.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: In his April 1976 general conference addresss, President Boyd K. Packer compared well-camouflaged crocodiles who prey on unwary victims to Satan, who preys on unwary youth by camouflaging the deadly nature of sin.

item.title: Who Are the Bond and Free?
item.description: (2 Nephi 26:33) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains who are the bond and the free.

item.title: Beware of False Prophets
item.description: (2 Nephi 26:29) Elder M. Russell Ballard warns of false prophets.

item.title: Saved by Grace
item.description: (2 Nephi 25:19–30) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about being saved by grace.

item.title: A Day When
item.description: (2 Nephi 15–20) President James E. Faust explains that the choices we make today determine tomorrow’s blessings and opportunities.

item.title: Fulfillment
item.description: (2 Nephi 12:2–3) Elder LeGrand Richards talks about fulfillment of prophecy.

item.title: The Lord's House
item.description: (2 Nephi 12:2–3) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about going to the Lord’s house.

item.title: The Atonement Is Essential to God’s Plan
item.description: (2 Nephi 11:2–8) President Boyd K. Packer talks about how the Atonement is essential to God’s plan . (“Do Not Fear,” Ensign, May 2004, 77–80.)

item.title: Individual Agency
item.description: (2 Nephi 10:23-25) President Thomas S. Monson talks about individual agency.

item.title: The Scattering and Gathering Is First Spiritual
item.description: (2 Nephi 10:6–8) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the scattering and gathering of Israel.

item.title: Look to Christ and Come Alive
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:41–52) President Gordon B. Hinckley expresses his joy in seeing how the gospel changes people for the better.

item.title: Christ Saves Us from Physical and Spiritual Death
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:6-24) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how Christ saves us from physical and spiritual death.

item.title: Physical and Spiritual Death
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:6–24) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches about physical and spiritual death in the plan of happiness.

item.title: Gathering to Lands of Promise
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:1-3) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about gathering to lands of promise.

item.title: We Are "Free to Choose"
item.description: (2 Nephi 2:27) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how we are free to choose.

item.title: Three Pillars of God's Plan
item.description: (2 Nephi 2:14–29) Elder Russell M. Nelson tells of the importance of the Creation, the Fall of Adam, and the Atonement in God's plan.

item.title: To Act or Be Acted Upon
item.description: (2 Nephi 2:14-29) President James E. Faust talks about acting or being acted upon.

item.title: Things to Act and Things to Be Acted Upon
item.description: (2 Nephi 2:13-14) Elder David A. Bednar talks about things to act and things to be acted upon.

item.title: Saved by the Merits of Christ
item.description: (2 Nephi 2:7-8) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about how we are saved through the merits of Christ.

item.title: opposition in all things
item.description: (2 Nephi 2:1–11) President Howard W. Hunter illustrates opposition by using a story about a Samoan boat race.

item.title: The Fall
item.description: (2 Nephi 2) Elder Bruce C. Hafen talks about the Fall of Adam.

item.title: Act for Themselves
item.description: (2 Nephi 2) A young man's alter ego shows him how all things are provided to allow him to use his agency to choose liberty and eternal life or captivity and spiritual death.

item.title: The Righteous Need Not Fear
item.description: (1 Nephi 22:17) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about how the righteous have no need to fear.

item.title: We Are "Graven" on the Palms of His Hands
item.description: (1 Nephi 21:13-16) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about how we are "graven" on the palms of His hands.

item.title: Liken All Scriptures
item.description: (1 Nephi 19:23-24) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about likening the scriptures unto ourselves.

item.title: Sensitivity to Spiritual Communication, Part 3
item.description: (1 Nephi 17:45) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about recognizing spiritual promptings .

item.title: Past Feeling
item.description: (1 Nephi 17:45) President James E. Faust talks about being past feeling.

item.title: Sensitivity to Spiritual Communication, Part 2
item.description: (1 Nephi 17:45) President Boyd K. Packer exhorts us to be sensitive to the sacredness of personal, spiritual experiences.

item.title: I Will Prepare the Way
item.description: (1 Nephi 17) The support and direction the Lord gave to Nephi when he was commanded to build a ship serves as a model for a young woman as she faces an overwhelming task of her own.

item.title: Our Own Liahona
item.description: (1 Nephi 16:16-32) Elder David A. Bednar talks about how the Book of Mormon can be our own Liahona.

item.title: The Word of God Strengthens Us
item.description: (1 Nephi 15:24) Elder Neal A. Maxwell testifies that the word of God strengthens us.

item.title: Book of Mormon Restores Plain and Precious Things
item.description: (1 Nephi 13:34-41) Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about how the Book of Mormon restores plain and precious things.

item.title: Lost Truths
item.description: (1 Nephi 13:32–40) President James E. Faust talks about lost truths.

item.title: The Spirit Cannot Abide
item.description: (1 Nephi 10:19) Elder David A. Bednar testifies that the Spirit only abides in clean things.

item.title: For a Wise Purpose
item.description: (1 Nephi 9) A seminary teacher uses oversized models of the Book of Mormon, the gold plates, and other source plates to help his students understand the structure of the book.

item.title: The Rod of Iron
item.description: (1 Nephi 8:19-33) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about the iron rod.

item.title: The Tree of Life as a Symbol of Jesus Christ and His Atonement
item.description: (1 Nephi 8:10–12; 11:8–25) Elder Neal A. Maxwell talks about how the tree of life is a symbol of Jesus Christ and His Atonement.

item.title: Searching the Scriptures
item.description: (1 Nephi 5:10-22) Elder Robert D. Hales speaks about searching the scriptures .

item.title: Scriptures Are of Great Worth
item.description: (1 Nephi 4:5-18) Elder L. Tom Perry testifies that the scriptures are of great worth.

item.title: I Will Go and Do
item.description: (1 Nephi 3:7) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about being willing to go and do the things the Lord commands.

item.title: God's Tender Mercies
item.description: (1 Nephi 1:20) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about God's tender mercies. ("The Tender Mercies of the Lord," Ensign, May 2005, 99.)

item.title: Importance of the Book of Mormon
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer testifies of the truths found in the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Book of Mormon Study
item.description: An introduction to the Book of Mormon by Elder L. Tom Perry.

item.title: The Book of Mormon
item.description: An introduction to the Book of Mormon by President Ezra Taft Benson.

item.title: For Our Day
item.description: Latter-day Saint youth from around the world describe the influence and guidance the Book of Mormon provides in their lives.

item.title: The Baptism of Fire
item.description: (2 Nephi 31:10–17) Elder David A. Bednar talks about the baptism of fire.

item.title: Majority
item.description: (Mosiah 29:26–27) Elder Neal A. Maxwell talks about the danger of the majority choosing what is not right.

item.title: Characteristics of Those Who Faithfully Share the Gospel
item.description: (Mosiah 28:1–9) Elder Henry B. Eyring speaks about some of the characteristics of those who share the gospel with others.

item.title: We Must Be “Born Again”
item.description: (Mosiah 27:23–30) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about being “born again”.

item.title: God Forgives
item.description: (Mosiah 26:29–31) Elder Russell M. Nelson testifies that God forgives.

item.title: The Lord Will Ease Our Burdens
item.description: (Mosiah 24:11–15) Elder Dallin H. Oaks testifies that the Lord will ease our burdens.

item.title: King of Kings
item.description: (Mosiah 23:6–14) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies of the Savior, our Lord and Master.

item.title: Safety Lies in Obeying the Prophets
item.description: (Mosiah 20:21; 21:1–4) Elder Robert D. Hales testifies of the blessings of following a living prophet of God.

item.title: Abinadi Converted One Soul
item.description: (Mosiah 18:1–4) Elder M. Russell Ballard gives the example of Abinadi converting one soul.

item.title: Stand as a Witness
item.description: (Mosiah 18:1–16) A young woman leaves home to attend a ballet workshop for six weeks and finds that standing as a witness of Christ gives her many opportunities to share the gospel with others.

item.title: Name of Christ
item.description: (Mosiah 5:7–11) Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about taking upon us the name of Christ.

item.title: No More Disposition to Do Evil
item.description: (Mosiah 5:2–3) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about having “no more disposition to do evil, but to do good continually”.

item.title: Watch Your Thoughts
item.description: (Mosiah 4:29–30) Elder Henry B. Eyring speaks about watching our thoughts.

item.title: Put off the Natural Man
item.description: (Mosiah 3:19) Elder Henry B. Eyring speaks about putting off the natural man.

item.title: Unprofitable Servants
item.description: (Mosiah 2:20–21) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about unprofitable servants.

item.title: In the Service of Your God
item.description: (Mosiah 2:17) President Marion G. Romney speaks about being “in the service of your God”.

item.title: Service That Counts
item.description: (Mosiah 2:11–21) President Thomas S. Monson speaks about service that counts.

item.title: The “Natural Man”
item.description: (Mosiah 2–5) Two young women learn what it means to put off the natural man and become children of Christ. Segment 1, The “Natural Man”.

item.title: Whole Soul unto God
item.description: (Omni 1:26) Elder David A. Bednar talks about bringing your whole soul unto God.

item.title: Brief Overview (Segment 4)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark. (The final segment is a two-minute Book of Mormon walkthrough.)

item.title: Alma 43 through Moroni (Segment 3)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark.

item.title: Omni through Alma 27 (Segment 2)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark.

item.title: 1 Nephi through Omni (Segment 1)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark.

item.title: Apply the Teachings of Christ
item.description: (Jarom 1:3–12) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about applying the teachings of Christ. (“Blessed Are the Peacemakers,” Ensign, Nov. 2002, 39–41.)

item.title: Having Enos-Like Faith
item.description: (Enos 1:1–8, 27) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about having Enos-like faith.

item.title: And My Soul Hungered
item.description: (Enos 1) A young man struggles before the Lord and learns what it means to receive a witness of the Spirit.

item.title: Enemies of Christ
item.description: (Jacob 7) President Ezra Taft Benson talks about exposing the enemies of Christ.

item.title: What Can I Say More?
item.description: (Jacob 6:7–13) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains Jacob’s plea, “O be wise; what can I say more?”.

item.title: The Olive Tree
item.description: (Jacob 5–6) A group of seminary students visit an Old Testament olive vineyard and are taught how to care for olive trees. They discover conditions in the vineyard that parallel the conditions in Zenos’s allegory. Segment 5, Song: “The Olive Tree".

item.title: All Fruit of the Vineyard is Corrupt
item.description: Seminary students visit an Old Testament olive vineyard and are taught how to care for olive trees. They discover conditions in the vineyard that parallel the conditions in Zenos's allegory. Segment 4 - All Fruit of the Vineyard is Corrupt. Jacob 5-6

item.title: Nethermost Parts of the Vineyard
item.description: (Jacob 5–6) Seminary students visit an Old Testament olive vineyard and are taught how to care for olive trees. They discover conditions in the vineyard that parallel the conditions in Zenos’s allegory. Segment 3, Nethermost Parts of the Vineyard.

item.title: Vineyard at the Time of Christ
item.description: (Jacob 5–6) Seminary students visit an Old Testament olive vineyard and are taught how to care for olive trees. They discover conditions in the vineyard that parallel the conditions in Zenos’s allegory. Segment 2, Old Testament Olive Vineyard.

item.title: Old Testament Olive Vineyard
item.description: (Jacob 5–6) Seminary students visit an Old Testament olive vineyard and are taught how to care for olive trees. They discover conditions in the vineyard that parallel the conditions in Zenos’s allegory. Segment 1, Old Testament Olive Vineyard

item.title: The Atonement Enables Us
item.description: (Jacob 4:6–7) Elder David A. Bednar speaks about how the Atonement enables us.

item.title: Chastity
item.description: (Jacob 2:28) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches about chastity.

item.title: Do Not Practice Polygamy
item.description: (Jacob 2:27–30) President Gordon B. Hinckley renounces the practice of polygamy.

item.title: The Lord Delights in Chastity
item.description: (Jacob 2:23–27) Elder Richard G. Scott cautions us about immorality.

item.title: Beginning to Labor in Sin
item.description: (Jacob 2:2–9) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about “beginning to labor in sin”.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 3, Conclusion.

item.title: Steve’s Simulation
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 2, Steve’s Simulation.

item.title: Pride Simulation Center
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 1, Pride Simulation Center.

item.title: The Awfulness of Sin and Terror That Follows
item.description: (Jacob 1:1–17; 2:11) President Harold B. Lee talks about the awfulness of sin.

item.title: Nehor Taught that a "Teacher Ought to Become Popular"
item.description: (Alma 1:3-4) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about Nehor's teachings

item.title: Tattoos
item.description: (Alma 3) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks against tattoos.

item.title: A Mighty Change of Heart
item.description: (Alma 5:12–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about “a mighty change” of heart.

item.title: The Healing Power of the Atonement
item.description: (Alma 7:11–13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about the healing power of the Atonement.

item.title: succor his people
item.description: (Alma 7:12) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about how the Lord will succor His people.

item.title: The Lord’s Help
item.description: (Alma 8:18-27) President Thomas S. Monson testifies that the Lord will provide a way to accomplish His work. (“Duty Calls,” Ensign, May 1996, 43–46.)

item.title: The Eternal Principle of Law and Justice
item.description: (Alma 9:18–25) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks of the great responsibility of the Saints and of what God expects of us.

item.title: Resurrection
item.description: (Alma 11:41-45)Elder Oaks speaks about the practicality of resurrection.

item.title: Resurrected Perfect Form
item.description: (Alma 11:42–45) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about the perfect form of our resurrected bodies with their spirits.

item.title: God Knows the Thoughts and Intents of Our Hearts
item.description: (Alma 12:1–8) President Thomas S. Monson urges us to never postpone a spiritual prompting, using an experience that helped save a depressed man’s life.

item.title: Judgment
item.description: (Alma 12:12–14) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about how we will be judged.

item.title: There Was a Plan of Redemption Laid
item.description: (Alma 12:22–34) Elder Russell M. Nelson explains the plan of redemption.

item.title: Foreordained to Bear the Priesthood
item.description: (Alma 13:1–5) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about being foreordained to bear the priesthood.

item.title: Foreordination
item.description: (Alma 13:3–5) Elder Neal A. Maxwell teaches that each of us must use our time and gifts wisely to prove ourselves chosen and faithful.

item.title: Ordinary Men and Women Can Be Made Pure
item.description: (Alma 13:10–13) Elder David A. Bednar talks about how ordinary people can be made pure.

item.title: Zeezrom Lay Sick
item.description: (Alma 15:1–3) President Boyd K. Packer speaks of spiritual disorders that may occur if we neglect our spirits.

item.title: Search the Scriptures Daily
item.description: (Alma 17:1–3) President Thomas S. Monson encourages us to search the scriptures daily.

item.title: Ammon Teaches King Lamoni
item.description: (Alma 18:12–23) President Henry B. Eyring speaks of loving people and having sincere concern for them.

item.title: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: (Alma 18:24-29) Elder M. Russell Ballard talks about how to successfully share the gospel of Jesus Christ in our everyday lives.

item.title: Anger Is an Indication of Weakness
item.description: (Alma 20:8–17) President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches of the power of self-discipline to control anger.

item.title: Understanding the Fall
item.description: (Alma 22:1–14) President Ezra Taft Benson expounds on the doctrine of the Fall of Adam as found in the Book of Mormon.

item.title: True Repentance Brings Hope
item.description: (Alma 22:15–18) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how true repentance brings hope.

item.title: Proclaiming the Gospel Brings Joy
item.description: (Alma 29:9–17) Elder Richard G. Scott speaks of the joy that comes in assisting others to understand and follow the Savior’s teachings.

item.title: All Things Denote There Is a God
item.description: (Alma 30) Korihor preaches against the prophecies of the coming of Christ. He seeks a sign to be convinced that there is a God. He is struck dumb.

item.title: Do Not Deny the Atonement’s Power
item.description: (Alma 26:17–20) Elder Richard G. Scott warns not to deny the Atonement’s power.

item.title: If We Are Well Prepared, Death Brings No Terror
item.description: (Alma 28:12–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches what soothes the sting and sadness caused by the death of a loved one.

item.title: Finding the Lamb of God
item.description: (Alma 31:5) President Boyd K. Packer speaks about finding the Lamb of God through the preaching of the word of God.

item.title: Receiving a Personal Testimony
item.description: (Alma 32:27–28) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about receiving a personal testimony.

item.title: The Atonement of Jesus Christ is Infinite and Eternal
item.description: (Alma 34:10–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches the infinite effects of the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: God Has Delivered Me
item.description: (Alma 36) A young man who plans to sin now and repent later discovers new insights into the process of repentance as he comes to understand the suffering and change Alma the Younger experienced in his conversion.

item.title: Someday
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring speaks about procrastinating repentance.

item.title: Racked with Eternal Torment
item.description: (Alma 36:12–17) President Boyd K. Packer talks about guilt and Alma’s experience of being racked with eternal torment.

item.title: When We Repent, the Atonement Removes Bitter Pain and Brings Exquisite Joy
item.description: (Alma 36:12–21) Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches the joy and blessings that come when we repent.

item.title: Replace Suffering with Joy
item.description: (Alma 36:18–21) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland testifies of the peace and renewal of repentance.

item.title: Learn in Thy Youth
item.description: (Alma 37:35) President Gordon B. Hinckley shares a story of the effects of neglecting a young tree.

item.title: These Things Are an Abomination
item.description: (Alma 39) Concerned about a friend who is heading down a path of sexual immorality, a young woman turns to her father for advice.

item.title: Unchastity Most Abominable
item.description: (Alma 39:1–11) President Boyd K. Packer speaks about chastity and the abomination of immorality.

item.title: Sexual Sin
item.description: (Alma 39:3) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland teaches the spiritual dangers and damages caused by sexual sin.

item.title: Next to Murder in Seriousness
item.description: (Alma 39:5) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland counsels on the importance of avoiding and fleeing sexual sin.

item.title: Sexual Sin is an Abomination in the Sight of the Lord
item.description: (Alma 39:9) Elder Dallin H. Oaks counsels young men to do everything possible to avoid pornography. Young women are counseled to dress modestly.

item.title: Proper and Perfect Frame
item.description: (Alma 40:23) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about the comfort in knowing that everyone will be resurrected; we can be strengthened by the knowledge that physical, mental, and emotional challenges in this life are temporary.

item.title: Wickedness Never Was Happiness
item.description: (Alma 41) Elder Glenn L. Pace shares that while the world may accept wickedness as good, the eternal truths of the gospel are unchanging. Indulging in wickedness can never bring joy.

item.title: Wickedness Never Was Happiness
item.description: (Alma 41:10–11) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about how “wickedness never was happiness”.

item.title: The Demands of Justice
item.description: (Alma 42:22–25) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about the demands of justice.

item.title: Captain Moroni
item.description: (Alma 43–48) A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni’s faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example that all Saints should follow. Segment 1, Captain Moron.

item.title: Firm in the Faith
item.description: (Alma 43–48) A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni’s faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example that all Saints should follow. Segment 2, Song: “Firm in the Faith”.

item.title: Fight for Families
item.description: (Alma 43:45–47) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fighting for the cause of the family.

item.title: Believers in the Book of Mormon
item.description: (Alma 46:13–15) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin teaches that Christians believe in the Savior and act in harmony with His teachings.

item.title: Don’t Leave the High Ground
item.description: (Alma 47:10–18) Elder Robert D. Hales warns us not to leave the high ground.

item.title: The Importance of Covenants
item.description: (Alma 53:10–21) Elder M. Russell Ballard talks about the difference between living by convenience and living by covenants. Living and keeping covenants brings spiritual power.

item.title: Stripling Warriors
item.description: (Alma 53:10–21) Elder M. Russell Ballard speaks about the stripling warriors and their valiant fight for liberty.

item.title: We Do Not Doubt Our Mothers Knew It
item.description: (Alma 56:31–48) Sister Julie B. Beck testifies of the need for responsible mothers who can teach their children to withstand the temptations of the world.

item.title: Choose Not to Be Offended
item.description: (Alma 61) Elder David A. Bednar talks about making the choice not to be offended.

item.title: Our Own Storehouse of Faith
item.description: (Alma 62:39–41) President James E. Faust talks about having our own storehouse of faith.

item.title: Nephi Prays for His People
item.description: The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 1, Nephi Prays for His People

item.title: Nephi Prophesies Death of Chief Judge
item.description: (Helaman 1–12) The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 2, Nephi Prophesies Death of Chief Judge.

item.title: Nephi Proves His Innocence
item.description: (Helaman 1–12) The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 3, Nephi Proves His Innocence.

item.title: Evil Secret Words Can Destroy Society
item.description: (Helaman 1-2) If we aren't careful, the temptations of secret combinations can weaken and ultimately destroy our communities.

item.title: Yielding Our Hearts to God
item.description: (Helaman 3:33–36) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about yielding our hearts to God.

item.title: The Spirit Does Not Dwell in Unholy Temples
item.description: (Helaman 4:23–26) Elder Robert D. Hales testifies that the Spirit does not dwell in unholy temples.

item.title: Build on the Rock of Our Redeemer
item.description: (Helaman 5:12) President Henry B. Eyring tells us to build on the rock of our Redeemer.

item.title: Secret Combinations
item.description: (Helaman 6:37–40) Elder M. Russell Ballard warns of secret combinations and their effects on society.

item.title: All Prophets Testify of Jesus Christ and His Atonement
item.description: (Helaman 7:17–20) Elder Russell M. Nelson discusses the focus on Christ found throughout the teachings and testimonies given by Book of Mormon prophets. They testify and declare that Jesus is the Christ.

item.title: Hold upon Your Hearts
item.description: (Helaman 7:15–22) Elder M. Russell Ballard warns of ignoring the future by focusing only on the present.

item.title: The Sealing Power Binds and Looses on Earth and in Heaven
item.description: (Helaman 10:4–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches what we must understand in preparing to receive temple ordinances.

item.title: Power in the Priesthood
item.description: (Helaman 11:4–17) Elder Bruce R. McConkie speaks of the incredible power of the priesthood.

item.title: The Cure for Forgetting God
item.description: (Helaman 12:1–6) President Henry B. Eyring tells us the cure for forgetting God.

item.title: The Lord Chastens His People to Stir Them Up in Remembrance of Him
item.description: (Helaman 12:3) Elder Glenn L. Pace talks about the spiritual devastation of disobedience to God’s commandments in the world. As in previous dispensations, the Lord allows “wake-up calls” to give his children opportunities to turn to Him.

item.title: Repentence Leads Us To Christ's Grace, 1
item.description: (Helaman 12:23-24) Elder Bednar shares how the grace of Jesus Christ blesses our lives.

item.title: Repentance Leads us to Christ's Grace, 2
item.description: (Helaman 12:23–24) Elder Gene R. Cook teaches how we can restore grace through the conditions of repentance. Grace is also obtained through keeping the commandments .

item.title: It Is Too Late
item.description: (Helaman 13:36–39) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how some people procrastinate the day of their salvation until it is too late. (“Now Is the Time to Prepare,” Ensign, May 2005, 16–18.)

item.title: Declare the Way to Safety
item.description: (Helaman 16:4–5) President Henry B. Eyring testifies of the Lord’s concern for our safety.

item.title: Alma 43 through Moroni (Segment 3)
item.description: An overview of people, places, and events, using a computer-generated model of the CES Book of Mormon bookmark.

item.title: Come unto Christ
item.description: (Moroni 10:32) Elder Richard G. Scott gives examples about coming unto Christ.

item.title: Hope Leads
item.description: (Moroni 10:20–23) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about hope.

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, 2
item.description: (Moroni 10:4-5) Elder Bruce R. McConkie calls each of us to earnestly seek to know the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, Part 1
item.description: (Moroni 10:4–5) President Boyd K. Packer shares his experiences in gaining a testimony of the truthfulness of the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Test Moroni’s Promise
item.description: (Moroni 10:3–5) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about testing Moroni’s promise.

item.title: Children Are Alive in Christ
item.description: (Moroni 8:4–23) President Boyd K. Packer gave personal examples of how children are alive in Christ.

item.title: Pure Love of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:45–48) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about the pure love of Christ and the connections open to us.

item.title: Charity: The Pure Love of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:44-48) Charity is an act, or state of being. It is something we become.

item.title: Light of Christ
item.description: (Moroni 7:12–19) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin talks about the importance of the Light of Christ.

item.title: Retaining Converts
item.description: (Moroni 6:4–9) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin expresses the importance of reaching out to new converts.

item.title: Fellowshipping, 2
item.description: (Moroni 6:4) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fellowshipping new converts.

item.title: Fellowshipping, 1
item.description: (Moroni 6:4) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about fellowshipping new converts.

item.title: The Importance of Ordinances in the Church of Jesus Christ, 2
item.description: (Moroni 2–5) President Boyd K. Packer teaches that without covenants, even good conduct cannot redeem nor exalt mankind.

item.title: The Importance of Ordinances in the Church of Jesus Christ, 1
item.description: (Moroni 2–5) President Boyd K. Packer shares the credentials required to return to Heavenly Father and the challenge to keep covenants in this life.

item.title: I, Moroni
item.description: (Moroni 1:1–4) With his story of ferocious wolves, Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin instructs us to keep our testimonies strong to withstand Satan’s temptations.

item.title: I, Moroni, Will Not Deny the Christ
item.description: (Moroni 1) Sister Susan W. Tanner talks about what we can do to prevail amid loneliness. We must cling to the Lord’s promises.

item.title: The Trial of Your Faith
item.description: (Ether 12:6) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that by acting upon impressions, you will receive confirming evidences of the Spirit, which strengthens your faith.

item.title: Great Faith Precedes Miracles
item.description: (Ether 12:5-22) President James E. Faust testifies that great faith is essential in overcoming challenges.

item.title: Trial of Your Faith
item.description: (Ether 12:4–6) President Boyd K. Packer gives a personal example about “the trial of your faith”. (“The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ—Plain and Precious Things, Ensign, May 2005, 6–9.)

item.title: Secret Combinations Destroy Civilizations
item.description: (Ether 8:20–26) Elder M. Russell Ballard speaks of the destructive power of secret combinations in today’s society.

item.title: A Steady, Reassuring Voice
item.description: (Ether 7:23–27) Elder Robert D. Hales teaches us to listen to the living prophets.

item.title: Testimony of the Witnesses
item.description: (Ether 5) Elder Dallin H. Oaks shares the significance of more than one witness to the Book of Mormon.

item.title: The Faith and Diligence of the Brother of Jared
item.description: (Ether 2:16; 3:5) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about the faith and diligence of the brother of Jared.

item.title: Written for Us Today
item.description: (Mormon 8:34–35) President Ezra Taft Benson explains that the Book of Mormon was meant for our generation. We must, therefore, make it a center point of our study.

item.title: Prepared for Our Day
item.description: (Mormon 8:12–41) Elder L. Tom Perry explains that the Book of Mormon was prepared for our day.

item.title: Bible and Book of Mormon
item.description: (Mormon 7:8–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the Bible and the Book of Mormon as witnesses of Jesus Christ.

item.title: In the Hands of God
item.description: (Mormon 5:23) Elder W. Craig Zwick talks about the keys we need to feel comfort and to receive direction from the Lord.

item.title: We Can Choose Our Path
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:20–42) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches that we cannot choose the consequences of our actions.

item.title: There Were No “Manner of –Ites”
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:16–17) Elder Richard G. Scott testifies that by aligning our traditions or customs with the Lord, we are promised happiness.

item.title: There Were "No Manner of -Ites"
item.description: (4th Nephi 1:16-17) President Faust talks about needing to find the value in one another and unifying the faith.

item.title: Truly Converted to the Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: (4 Nephi 1:1–19) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains what conversion truly means. We qualify for eternal life through conversion as we “do” and “become”.

item.title: Jesus and His Prophets
item.description: (4 Nephi 1) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin gives an example of the importance of following our leaders.

item.title: We Are the Covenant People of the Lord
item.description: (3 Nephi 28:30) Elder Russell M. Nelson explains some of the blessings of the Abrahamic covenant and that we are among the covenant people of the Lord.

item.title: The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon Signaled the Beginning of the Gathering of Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 29:1–2) President Ezra Taft Benson teaches the value of the Book of Mormon as a tool in converting the world to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: What Manner of Men Ought Ye to Be?
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:27) President James E. Faust speaks about what kind of people we should be to be good disciples.

item.title: Gospel Is Good News
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:13–22) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the word gospel means good news and refers to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Tell Us the Name Whereby We Shall Call This Church
item.description: (3 Nephi 27:3–8) President Gordon B. Hinckley talks about what it means to take upon us the name of Christ. Be faithful in fulfilling the duties and responsibilities in your sphere of responsibility.

item.title: Too Sacred to Discuss
item.description: (3 Nephi 26:13–21) President Boyd K. Packer speaks of the importance of not talking about sacred experiences.

item.title: Additional Scriptures
item.description: (3 Nephi 26:9–10) Elder Neal A. Maxwell explains that by giving heed to what the Lord has revealed, we prepare to receive greater revelation.

item.title: Our Obedience to Gospel Principles Helps us Prepare for the Second Coming of Jesus Christ
item.description: (3 Nephi 25:6) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about Elijah.

item.title: No Weapon that is Formed Against Thee Shall Prosper
item.description: (3 Nephi 22:17) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that those who oppose God’s work will not prevail. The righteous will press forward amid the opposition.

item.title: Jesus Wants Us to Succeed
item.description: (3 Nephi 22:6–10) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf explains why Jesus wants us to succeed.

item.title: The Book of Mormon Gathers Scattered Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 21:1–7) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the Book of Mormon gathers scattered Israel.

item.title: Who is the Seed of Abraham?
item.description: (3 Nephi 20:24–29) President James E. Faust talks about what it means to be the seed of Abraham.

item.title: We Can Have His Light
item.description: (3 Nephi 19:16–36) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about how we can have God’s light through the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Pray in Your Families
item.description: (3 Nephi 18:13–25) President James E. Faust talks about the importance of praying in your families.

item.title: Church Members should Extend Fellowship to All People, 1
item.description: (3 Nephi 18:22-32) Elder M. Russell Ballard explains the urgency of retaining new converts

item.title: Partake of the Sacrament
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks about the sacrament prayers.

item.title: Jesus Blessed the Children “One by One”
item.description: (3 Nephi 17:14–25) Elder Jeffrey R. Holland talks about how Jesus blessed the children and prayed for them.

item.title: God’s Laws Bless His Children
item.description: (3 Nephi 15:1–10) Elder L. Tom Perry testifies that God’s laws govern and bless His children. (“We Believe All That God Has Revealed,” Ensign, Nov. 2003, 85–88.)

item.title: The Golden Rule
item.description: (3 Nephi 14:12) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the golden rule encompasses the moral code.

item.title: God Forgive Us as We Forgive Others
item.description: (3 Nephi 13:11, 14–15) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches of extending and receiving forgiveness.

item.title: Be Ye Therefore Perfect
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:48) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of the charge to become perfect like the Savior.

item.title: Going the Extra Mile
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:38–42) President James E. Faust teaches that some of the most rewarding times of our lives are from going the extra mile.

item.title: Salt of the Earth
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:13) Elder Dallin H. Oaks explains that being the salt of the earth is our covenant duty.

item.title: Salt of the Earth
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:13) Elder Carlos E. Asay tells how men might lose their “savor” as priesthood holders. He shares guidelines to help maintain spiritual strength in the priesthood. (“Salt of the Earth: Savor of Men and Saviors of Men,” Ensign, May 1980.)

item.title: Covenants and Ordinances
item.description: (3 Nephi 11:14–17) Elder David A. Bednar explains that we come unto Christ through covenants and ordinances.

item.title: Christ Brings Light Where There Is Darkness
item.description: (3 Nephi 10:9–13) Elder Robert D. Hales testifies of the comfort the gospel brings.

item.title: A Change in the Commandment to Sacrifice
item.description: (3 Nephi 9:20) Elder D. Todd Christofferson teaches that the sacrifice the Lord accepts is the gift of yourself—a broken heart and a contrite spirit.

item.title: The Devil Rejoices When We Sin
item.description: (3 Nephi 9:2, 13–15) Elder Robert D. Hales explains that the devil never has joy unless we sin; it is our sins that make him laugh.

item.title: True Conversion
item.description: (3 Nephi 7:21–26) Elder Richard G. Scott tells what conversion is and how it can lead to aligning our views to the Lord’s. He teaches how to become truly converted.

item.title: Pride Is Enmity
item.description: (3 Nephi 6:10–18) President Gordon B. Hinckley reads a message by President Ezra Taft Benson about the danger of pride.

item.title: A Living Sacrifice
item.description: (3 Nephi 2:1–3) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about a living sacrifice.

item.title: Chapter 1: How We Got the Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph Smith sees a vision of God and Jesus Christ. An angel, Moroni, instructs him and shows him where to find an ancient record. Joseph translates the record by the power of God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Lehi Warns the People
item.description: Lehi warns the people of Jerusalem to repent or they will soon be destroyed. The people are angry with Lehi and try to kill him.

item.title: Chapter 3: Lehi Leaves Jerusalem
item.description: The Lord warns Lehi to flee with his family into the wilderness. Lehi's son, Nephi, prays and believes his father's words but his two other brothers, Laman and Lemuel, rebel.

item.title: Chapter 4: The Brass Plates
item.description: Lehi sends his sons back to Jerusalem to get the brass plates from King Laban. After many attempts they are able to get the plates and, Zoram, one of Laban's servants, comes with them.

item.title: Chapter 5: Traveling in the Wilderness
item.description: Ishmael and his family join Lehi's family in the wilderness. The sons of Lehi marry the daughters of Ishmael. They have many trials in the wilderness, and some of them rebel. They reach the seashore and name the land Bountiful.

item.title: Chapter 6: Lehi’s Dream
item.description: Lehi shares a dream he had with his family. In his dream he saw a tree with fruit that would make you happy. Various groups of people either partake of the fruit, get lost on their way to the tree, or mock those who partake of the fruit.

item.title: Chapter 7: Building the Ship
item.description: The Lord instructs Nephi to build a ship and reveals to Nephi the design and method for making the ship. Laman and Lemuel mock Nephi for attempting to build a ship.

item.title: Chapter 8: Crossing the Sea
item.description: Lehi and his family set off in the ship for the promised land. Laman and Lemuel become angry and tie Nephi up with ropes. A storm arises and does not subside until Laman and Lemuel untie Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 9: A New Home in the Promised Land
item.description: Lehi and his family arrive in the promised land. The Lord commands Nephi to keep a record. After Lehi dies, Laman and Lemuel rebel and their families separate themselves from those who follow Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Sherem
item.description: Nephi dies, and his brother Jacob becomes the leader. A wicked man named Sherem tells people not to believe in Christ. Jacob speaks with Sherem, ands after a sign from God, Sherem repents and tells the people to believe in Christ.

item.title: Chapter 11: Enos
item.description: Jacob's son Enos prays all day and into the night, and his sins are forgiven. He prays for the Nephites and the Lamanites. Enos spends the rest of his life serving God and teaching people the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 12: King Benjamin
item.description: King Benjamin addresses his people and prophesies about the life of Jesus Christ. The people believe his teachings and covenant to keep the commandments. King Benjamin's son Mosiah is appointed to be the next king.

item.title: Chapter 13: Zeniff
item.description: The Lamanites allow Zeniff and his people to live in their land. The Lamanites agree to not attack, but they do not honor their promise. The Nephites pray for strength. They are able to defeat the Lamanites for two generations.

item.title: Chapter 14: Abinadi and King Noah
item.description: Abinadi teaches wicked King Noah and his priests. King Noah becomes angry and has Abinadi killed. Alma, one of King Noah’s priests, believes Abinadi and flees.

item.title: Chapter 15: Alma Teaches and Baptizes
item.description: Alma writes down the words of Abinadi and preaches the gospel to the Nephites. Many people follow him and are baptized. The army of King Noah comes looking for them, but they escape and establish a righteous civilization.

item.title: Chapter 16: King Limhi and His People Escape
item.description: Limhi becomes the king of the Nephites who were captured by the Lamanites. Ammon and other Nephites arrive from Zarahemla and help King Limhi's people to escape and return to Zarahemla.

item.title: Chapter 17: Alma and His People Escape
item.description: Lamanites take over the land of Alma and his people. They pray to God to be freed. God strengthens them and prepares a way for them to escape. They make it to Zarahemla and are welcomed by King Mosiah and his people.

item.title: Chapter 18: Alma the Younger Repents
item.description: Alma becomes the leader of the Church. His son Alma the Younger and the sons of Mosiah persecute the followers of Christ. An angel appears to them and calls them to repentance. They repent and try to repair the evil they did.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Sons of Mosiah Become Missionaries
item.description: The four sons of Mosiah desire to preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They all refuse to be king. King Mosiah prays, and the Lord tells him to let his sons go. They fast and pray that they will be good missionaries.

item.title: Chapter 20: Alma and Nehor
item.description: Alma the Younger becomes the first chief judge. A wicked man named Nehor leads many away with his lies and kills Gideon. Nehor is put to death, but many still believe his words. Those who continue to follow God and care for the poor are blessed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Amlicites
item.description: Amlici, a wicked Nephite, wants to become king, and many follow him. The people vote, and he is not made king. He and his followers fight against the righteous Nephites. The Nephites are blessed with strength and defeat the Amlicites.

item.title: Chapter 22: Alma’s Mission to Ammonihah
item.description: Alma steps down as chief judge to spread the gospel. Alma finds Amulek, and they preach together. Zeezrom tries to confound them but is unable to do so. Zeezrom and others repent and are baptized. The believers are persecuted.

item.title: Chapter 23: Ammon: A Great Servant
item.description: Ammon becomes a servant of King Lamoni. He defends the king’s flock from a band of robbers. King Lamoni is impressed with Ammon’s faithfulness. Ammon teaches King Lamoni, and he is converted.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ammon Meets King Lamoni’s Father
item.description: Ammon and King Lamoni go to rescue Aaron out of prison. They meet King Lamoni’s father on the way. At first, his father is very angry, but his heart is softened and he helps free Aaron from prison.

item.title: Chapter 25: Aaron Teaches King Lamoni’s Father
item.description: Aaron goes to the land of King Lamoni's father and teaches him the gospel. He is converted, and many believe him.

item.title: Chapter 26: The People of Ammon
item.description: The sons of Mosiah teach many Lamanites who repent and join the Church. They become known as the Anti-Nephi-Lehies. They are hard-working people who make a promise to God that they will never kill again.

item.title: Chapter 27: Korihor
item.description: Korihor preaches wickedness. Many people believe Korihor and are led astray. He demands a sign from Alma. Korihor is struck dumb by the Lord.

item.title: Chapter 28: The Zoramites and the Rameumptom
item.description: Alma and Amulek find success among the poor Zoramites. They teach them about faith, Jesus Christ, and God's plan for His children.

item.title: Chapter 29: Alma Teaches about Faith and the Word of God
item.description: Alma teaches the Zoramites about faith. He says that faith is believing something that is true but that cannot be seen. He teaches that if you continue to study the gospel, your faith will become stronger.

item.title: Chapter 30: Alma Counsels His Sons
item.description: Alma counsels with his three sons. He commends Helaman and Shiblon for their faith, but he chastises Corianton for breaking the commandments and setting a bad example for the Zoramites. Alma and his sons continue to preach the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 31: Captain Moroni Defeats Zerahemnah
item.description: Zerahemnah, the leader of the Lamanites, brings his army to fight the Nephites. Captain Moroni's army is well prepared and battle against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 32: Captain Moroni and the Title of Liberty
item.description: A wicked man named Amalickiah wants to be king over the Nephites. Many Nephites leave the Church and follow him. Captain Moroni erects the title of liberty and encourages the Nephites to protect their freedom.

item.title: Chapter 33: King-Men versus Freemen
item.description: The Nephites in favor of a king refuse to help fight with Captain Moroni against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 34: Helaman and the 2,000 Young Warriors
item.description: The Nephite leaders don't want the people of Ammon to break their promise and help fight against the Lamanites. Their sons decide to fight. Helaman leads the 2,000 sons to battle. None are killed, because of their great faith.

item.title: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran
item.description: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran Captain Moroni writes to Pahoran asking for more soldiers and supplies to help Helaman and his army. Pahoran is unable to send help, however, because a group of wicked Nephites has joined with the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 36: Hagoth
item.description: Hagoth and a group of Nephites leave Zarahemla and travel north. They built ships and set sail. They took food and supplies and were never heard from again.

item.title: Chapter 37: Nephi and Lehi in Prison
item.description: Nephi and Lehi, the sons of Helaman, preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They are thrown into prison but escape by a ring of fire.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Murder of the Chief Judge
item.description: Nephi prophesies about the chief judge’s murder. Many people are convinced that Nephi is a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 39: Nephi Receives Great Power
item.description: Nephi is saddened by the wickedness of the Nephites. He prays for a famine to humble them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Samuel the Lamanite Tells about Jesus Christ
item.description: The Lord sends Samuel, a Lamanite prophet, among the Nephites. He prophesies of the signs of Christ’s birth and death.

item.title: Chapter 41: The Signs of Christ’s Birth
item.description: The unbelieving Nephites appoint a day when they will kill the believers if the sign of Christ’s birth has not appeared. Nephi, the son of Nephi, prays in behalf of the believers. The Lord comforts Nephi, and the sign appears the next day.

item.title: Chapter 42: The Signs of Christ’s Crucifixion
item.description: Great storms, thunderings, and earthquakes arise after the death of Christ. There is darkness for three days, and out of the darkness the survivors hear the voice of Jesus Christ calling them to repentance.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Christ Appears to the Nephites
item.description: Christ descends out of heaven. He speaks to the people gathered at the temple and teaches them about baptism. He calls Twelve Apostles .

item.title: Chapter 44: Jesus Christ Blesses the Children
item.description: Christ tells the Nephites to bring their children to him. He offers a prayer that is so marvelous that the words of it could not be written. Christ blesses the children one by one, and they are surrounded and ministered to by angels from heaven.

item.title: Chapter 45: Jesus Christ Teaches about the Sacrament and Prayer
item.description: Christ demonstrates and explains the sacrament. He teaches the people to pray always in his name. He gives the twelve disciples the power to give others the Holy Ghost. The disciples witness Christ ascending to heaven.

item.title: Chapter 46: Jesus Christ Teaches and Prays with the Nephites
item.description: Angels minister to those who were baptized, and Christ appears again. Christ prays to Heavenly Father. He gives the people the sacrament. After Jesus returns to heaven, his disciples teach and baptize many more people.

item.title: Chapter 47: Jesus Christ Blesses His Disciples
item.description: Christ comes to the twelve disciples when they are fasting and praying. He teaches them the gospel and tells them to write down his words. He promises each of the Twelve distinct blessings.

item.title: Chapter 48: Peace in America
item.description: After Jesus returns to live with Heavenly Father, the people are blessed. Many more people are baptized, and there is peace in the land.

item.title: Chapter 49: Mormon and His Teachings
item.description: Many years after Jesus visited the Nephites, Mormon becomes responsible for the sacred records of the people. The people are very wicked. Mormon leads the people into battle, but because of their wickedness, all people are destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 50: The Jaredites Leave Babel
item.description: During the destruction of the Tower of Babel, the Lord spares the languages of Jared’s family. They gather supplies and go where the Lord directs.

item.title: Chapter 51: The Jaredites Travel to the Promised Land
item.description: The Jaredites build barges according to the Lord’s instructions. The brother of Jared asks the Lord to touch stones to provide light in the barges. He sees the Lord. The Jaredites travel to the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Destruction of the Jaredites
item.description: The wicked Jaredites try to kill the prophets and have many wars. The prophet Ether warns the wicked King Coriantumr about the destruction of his people. Eventually, all people are destroyed. Ether records the history of the Jaredites.

item.title: Chapter 53: Moroni and His Teachings
item.description: After Mormon dies, Moroni writes important doctrine about the sacrament, baptism, and the Savior. The wicked Lamanites kill Nephites who would not deny Jesus Christ. Moroni knew he would return to live with Heavenly Father when he died.

item.title: Chapter 54: The Promise of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Before Moroni buried the plates, he wrote a promise that if people would ask sincerely if the records were true, the Holy Ghost would testify of the truth. He hid the plates in the Hill Cumorah.

item.title: My Joy Is Full
item.description: Visual and music highlight this portrayal of the Savior's visit to the inhabitants of ancient America, providing a unique view of His caring, compassion, and love for His children.

item.title: Becoming Children of Christ
item.description: Two young women learn what it means to put off the natural man and become children of Christ.

item.title: Firm in the Faith of Christ
item.description: A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni's faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example all Saints should follow.

item.title: O Ye Fair Ones
item.description: As Mormon and his son Moroni behold the hundreds of thousands of Nephites slain in the last battle with the Lamanites, Mormon laments, "O ye fair ones, how could ye have departed from the ways of the Lord!"

item.title: The Mediator
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1977 general conference address. A young man who fails to pay a debt is saved from the grasp of justice through the mediation of a friend.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1976 general conference address. Just as well-camouflaged crocodiles prey on unwary victims, Satan preys on unwary youth by using tactics that camouflage the deadly nature of sin.

item.title: The Pride Cycle
item.description: An illustration of the great pride of the people of Zarahemla about twenty years before the birth of the Savior. The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people's wickedness.

item.title: Can You Imagine?
item.description: A young man's alter ego uses a courtroom setting to explore what it would be like to stand before God on Judgment Day.
